abstract: Celebrating Yom Kippur with burgers on the beach.
snippet: Celebrating Yom Kippur with burgers on the beach.
lead_paragraph: For the last 18 years, my mother and I have spent Yom Kippur, the holiest day of the Jewish calendar, at Tod's Point beach in Old Greenwich, Conn., near where I grew up and where my mother still lives. I'm a TV producer living in Brooklyn now, but I still go back every year. My mom reads my father's old prayer book while I order lunch for us from the greasy concession stand that stays open into the fall, double hamburgers with grilled onions and French fries.
